name: PyBCN Online: Taula Rodona sobre Python
description:
Taula Rodona sobre Python (Python Round Table)

We kickstart the new season of PyBCN with a virtual round table where we will talk about Python, the pandemic situation and its impact on the developer labour market and remote events.

The temptative members for the round table will be:
- Ruben Berenguel (@berenguel), Lead Data Engineer
- Alberto Cámara (@b3r2s), Senior Data Scientist
- David Arcos (@DZPM), CTO
- Julio Martínez (@liopic), Senior Data Engineer
- ...

Language: Català

You will be able to send your questions during the talk, there will be a Q&A at the end. We may add more people to the discussion as we see fit.

NOTICE that this meetup will be ONLINE!

- Online platform will be Youtube Live via the provided link.
- You will be able to use the chat there to ask your questions
----------

name: PyBCN Online: Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic in the IT labor market
description:
"Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic in the IT labor market"

Dani Martos, Recruitment Manager at Travelperk and member of PyBCN, will share with us some insights about the present and future changes in the labour due the Covid-19 pandemic.

Language: English
You will be able to send your questions during the talk, there will be a Q&A at the end.

name: February PyBCN Practice Sessions: Python & RabbitMQ
description:
• What we will do?
We will look at how to interact with message brokers using Python with the example of RabbitMQ, one of the most popular open source message brokers.

• What will you need to bring?
Willingness to enjoy and learn, a laptop with Python 3 and your preferred virtual environment system installed.

• Requirements:
- You should know basic Python
- You should bring your laptop with Python version 3
- Your preferred virtual environment system already installed

• Python Packages:
- https://github.com/pika/pika

• Venue
Punt Multimèdia Espanya Industrial
Carrer de Muntadas 5 (Casa del Mig) · Barcelona

This session will be in English or Spanish, depending on the audience.

name: Python February Meetup
description:
# Talks

- 1) "Automatically intercepting & debugging all Python HTTP(S)" by Tim Perry
HTTP Toolkit (http://httptoolkit.tech/) is an open-source HTTP(S) debugging tool that can completely automatically capture and/or rewrite all HTTP(S) traffic from your Python code, for debugging & testing.

That sounds a lot like magic. In this talk, we'll look at how it really works: how HTTP Toolkit can automatically man-in-the-middle all your requests, with no admin permissions or code changes necessary. We'll learn a bit about how HTTP interception works, see why this is useful, and then explore how HTTP Toolkit injects into the Python's own internals to make this happen.
twitter: @pimterry

Duration: 30 minutes
Language: English

- 2) "Migracode: Creating a Migrant-Tech Community" by Vincent van Grondelle
We are currently running Migracode: the first code school for refugees and migrants in Barcelona. Through free tech education we offer vulnerable groups to become Junior Web Developers, and we also help them connect to tech companies throughout Catalunya and Spain, and possibly throughout Europe. We would love to present our project in the Python Community and find potential partners, volunteers and other opportunities. We also have a lot to offer regarding Corporate Social Responsibility and our talk also includes this part.
twitter: @vsvangrondelle

Duration: 30 minutes
Language: English

# Access Control
- The security access control requires an attendee list. Provide your full name in your profile, otherwise you will be REMOVED from the list.
- People under 18 years old only allowed accompanied by one parent or legal guardian.
- There are limited seats, please BE RESPONSIBLE when signing up. If you can't make it, please free up your seat, so someone else can attend. We keep a blacklist with repeated offenders!

# More
- We need talk proposals! Send yours: https://pybcn.org/call-for-proposals
- Wanna publish a job offer? https://pybcn.org/job-offers
- Follow @PyBCN for pictures, slides, videos and more: https://twitter.com/pybcn

name: Python January Meetup
description:
# Talks

- 1) "Jazz chord generation using Deep Learning" by Mateusz Dorobek
I'll tell you about jazz chords progressions generation using recurrent neural networks. Staring with "what is a chord?" I'll go through "How we can represent chord?" and "How we can embed chords?". There will be a lot about music from a computer point of view. I'll show how I've prepared the music data, and how to use recurrent neural networks to generate jazz chords sequences. We will analyze the results and discuss the future of music in a world of AI.
linkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/mateuszdorobek/
website: https://www.mateuszdorobek.pl/
Github: https://github.com/SaxMan96/
research gate: https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Mateusz_Dorobek

Duration: 30 minutes
Language: English

- 2) "Using pydantic for security static analysis of AWS cloudformation files" by Oscar Blanco
In Skyscanner we've developed CFRipper, a tool that checks for security issues in cloudformation files. In order to write this tool we use pydantic heavily to model the cloudformation files.
In this talk we'll introduce pydantic and use cfripper and pycfmodel as use cases for the library.
twitter: @oscarbc96
github: https://github.com/oscarbc96

Duration: 30 minutes
Language: English

- 3) "Inversión de control e Inyección de dependencias, Teoría y ejemplos usando `Injector`" by Manuel Gomez, Daniel Albarral

La charla constará de dos partes, primero se explicarán los conceptos de Inversión de Control e Inyección de dependencias y para qué podemos usar estas técnicas; a continuación se mostrarán ejemplos de cómo usar estas técnicas en Python mediante la librería Injector (https://github.com/alecthomas/injector) .

Duration: 30 minutes
Language: Spanish

# Access Control
- The security access control requires an attendee list. Provide your full name in your profile, otherwise you will be REMOVED from the list.
- People under 18 years old only allowed accompanied by one parent or legal guardian.
- There are limited seats, please BE RESPONSIBLE when signing up. If you can't make it, please free up your seat, so someone else can attend. We keep a blacklist with repeated offenders!

- Follow @PyBCN for pictures, slides, videos and more: https://twitter.com/pybcn

name: January PyBCN Practice Sessions: Dealing with legacy code
description:
• What we will do?
In this session we'll see how to deal with legacy code, improve it and get ready to add new features with ease, using tests, coverage, golden master, .

• What you need to bring?
Willing to enjoy and learn, a laptop with Python 3.7 and your preferred virtual environment system with pytest and pytest-cov installed.

• Requirements:
* You should know basic Python and testing
* You should bring your laptop with Python 3.7.
* Your preferred virtual environment system already installed.
* pytest and pytest-cov python packages installed.

• Venue
Punt Multimèdia Espanya Industrial
Carrer de Muntadas 5 (Casa del Mig) · Barcelona

This session will be in English or Catalan or Spanish, depending on the audience.

name: Python November Meetup
description:
# Talks

- 1) "Avoid food waste with QR codes and computer vision" by Ismael Benito

At ColorSensing, a spin-off from University of Barcelona, we are developing both a general SaaS solution to digitalize colorimetric sensors and also a specific solution with colorimetric gas sensors to study the behaviour of food modified athmosphere packaging (MAP). We aim to impact the value chain in the food market with real traceability of the sealed food packages.

Duration: 30 minutes
Language: English

- 2) "Machine Learning with Electronic Health Record (EHR) Systems" by Gabriel de Maeztu.
EHR systems can have data from a variety of different sources including billing data, patient demographics, medical history, lab results, sensor data, prescriptions, clinical notes, medical images, etc.

I will cover a couple of ML models that use this kind of data to cover different use cases and i'll talk about the multiple bias that the data might have.

Duration: 45 minutes
Language: English

# Access Control
- The security access control requires an attendee list. Provide your full name in your profile, otherwise you will be REMOVED from the list.
- People under 18 years old only allowed accompanied by one parent or legal guardian.
- There are limited seats, please BE RESPONSIBLE when signing up. If you can't make it, please free up your seat, so someone else can attend. We keep a blacklist with repeated offenders!

name: PyDayBCN 2019
description:
PyDay BCN 2019 is almost here! It will take place on November 16th at Universitat de Barcelona. Save the date!

A day full of FREE python-related activities for the Python community. Over the last two editions, PyDay has become a great opportunity to share our love for Python and engage users, companies and newcomers into it!

Information and register: https://pybcn.org/pyday-bcn-2019/

-----

Cheers,

The PyDayBCN Team

name: September PyBCN Practice Sessions: Intro to Natural Language Processing (NLP)
description:
• What we will do?
Come to start the journey into natural language processing using SpaCy in Python.
This workshop will take us into concepts like tokens, text, lemmatization, sentiment analysis ...
• What you need to bring?
Willing to enjoy and learn, a laptop with Python 3.7 and your preferred virtual environment system installed.

• Requirements:
* You should know basic Python and basic numpy
* You should bring your laptop with Python 3.7.
* Your preferred virtual environment system already installed.
* spaCy python package installed.
* Spanish and English full models installed
Follow this instructions if you don't have spaCy already installed:
https://spacy.io/usage/

• Venue
Punt Multimèdia Espanya Industrial
Carrer de Muntadas 5 (Casa del Mig) · Barcelona

name: MeetUp Python Alicante
description:
¡ MeetUp Python Alicante !

O lo que es lo mismo, una quedada informal dónde hablaremos sobre Python, nuestros proyectos en los que estamos trabajando tanto de forma profesional como por afición.

Al ser un evento informal, no hace falta que tengas ningún conocimiento previo, solo interés por la programación en general y en Python en particular; así que es una buena oportunidad si quieres empezar.

• Qué has de traer
Ganas de participar y hacer comunidad.
